title: More than 40,000 killed in Israel’s war in Gaza, Health Ministry says
content: The Gaza Health Ministry does not distinguish between civilians and combatants but aid workers and experts say the 40,000 figure is probably an undercount.
summary: The Gaza Health Ministry does not distinguish between civilians and combatants but aid workers and experts say the 40,000 figure is probably an undercount.

title: Gaza cease-fire talks resume in Qatar without Hamas in attendance
content: Israel and the United States, with mediating partners Egypt and Qatar, resumed high-stakes negotiations in Doha over a cease-fire and hostage-release deal.
summary: Israel and the United States, with mediating partners Egypt and Qatar, resumed high-stakes negotiations in Doha over a cease-fire and hostage-release deal.

title: Ukraine offensive in Russia larger than Kursk region, soldiers say
content: Ukraine says Russia has been in contact about a new prisoner exchange amid reports that hundreds of Russian servicemen have been seized in the Kursk operation.
summary: Ukraine says Russia has been in contact about a new prisoner exchange amid reports that hundreds of Russian servicemen have been seized in the Kursk operation.

title: Russia sentences American woman to 12 years for donation aiding Ukraine
content: The woman, Ksenia Karelina, a beautician living in Los Angeles, was visiting family in Russia when she was arrested at the airport over a donation of about $50 to an aid group.
summary: The woman, Ksenia Karelina, a beautician living in Los Angeles, was visiting family in Russia when she was arrested at the airport over a donation of about $50 to an aid group.

title: Israel is redrawing the West Bank, cutting into a prospective Palestinian state
content: Israeli land grabs, settlement expansion and demolitions in Palestinian communities mark the most significant territorial changes in the West Bank in decades.
summary: Israeli land grabs, settlement expansion and demolitions in Palestinian communities mark the most significant territorial changes in the West Bank in decades.

title: What to know about Olympic boxer Imane Khelif’s cyberbullying complaint
content: French investigators are looking into charges including gender-based cyber harassment and public insult after the gold medalist was targeted in online attacks.
summary: French investigators are looking into charges including gender-based cyber harassment and public insult after the gold medalist was targeted in online attacks.

title: India pressed U.S. to go easy on Bangladeshi leader before her ouster, officials say
content: After Indian lobbying, Washington toned down its criticism of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. Now both countries must confront whether they mishandled Bangladesh.
summary: After Indian lobbying, Washington toned down its criticism of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. Now both countries must confront whether they mishandled Bangladesh.

title: Britain hands out prison terms for far-right riots in swift crackdown
content: More than 1,000 people have been arrested and roughly half of that number charged, police said.
summary: More than 1,000 people have been arrested and roughly half of that number charged, police said.

title: Biden’s Gaza cease-fire plan teeters on brink ahead of high-stakes talks
content: Looming over the negotiations are threats by Iran and Hezbollah to strike back against Israel after the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran.
summary: Looming over the negotiations are threats by Iran and Hezbollah to strike back against Israel after the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran.

title: Ukraine unleashes attacks on Russian airfields amid Kursk offensive
content: After rushing reinforcements to Kursk and announcing a “counterterrorism” operation, Russian forces have failed to halt the nine-day incursion.
summary: After rushing reinforcements to Kursk and announcing a “counterterrorism” operation, Russian forces have failed to halt the nine-day incursion.

title: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida to step down next month
content: Kishida said he will stand down as leader of the Liberal Democratic Party, and therefore as prime minister, to allow the party to recover from recent scandals.
summary: Kishida said he will stand down as leader of the Liberal Democratic Party, and therefore as prime minister, to allow the party to recover from recent scandals.

title: A charity gave donated candy to families. It turned out to be meth.
content: New Zealand police are investigating the source of the candies, which were packed in Rinda-branded wrapping and had a potentially lethal concentration of meth.
summary: New Zealand police are investigating the source of the candies, which were packed in Rinda-branded wrapping and had a potentially lethal concentration of meth.

title: As Vietnam tightens leash on criticism, scores are jailed and exiled
content: The crackdown on human rights comes at a time when the United States is deepening security and economic ties with Hanoi.
summary: The crackdown on human rights comes at a time when the United States is deepening security and economic ties with Hanoi.

title: Ukraine turns the tables on Russia
content: A bold Ukrainian operation in Kursk has humiliated Russian President Vladimir Putin and upended some of the logic of the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine.
summary: A bold Ukrainian operation in Kursk has humiliated Russian President Vladimir Putin and upended some of the logic of the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine.

title: U.N. experts say Venezuela election results lack basic transparency
content: A panel of four U.N. experts criticized Venezuela’s decision to announce an election outcome without offering a detailed breakdown of the vote.
summary: A panel of four U.N. experts criticized Venezuela’s decision to announce an election outcome without offering a detailed breakdown of the vote.

title: U.S. plans to sell $20 billion in weapons to Israel over several years
content: The Biden administration approved a deal to sell F-15s, air-to-air missiles and munitions, but much of it won’t arrive in Israel until 2026 at the earliest.
summary: The Biden administration approved a deal to sell F-15s, air-to-air missiles and munitions, but much of it won’t arrive in Israel until 2026 at the earliest.

title: Suspected Iranian hacks are latest round of U.S. election interference
content: National security officials and researchers noted a rise in “troublesome” Iranian influence operations designed to meddle in the U.S. presidential race.
summary: National security officials and researchers noted a rise in “troublesome” Iranian influence operations designed to meddle in the U.S. presidential race.

title: Defense secretary’s intervention in 9/11 cases faces judge’s scrutiny
content: A judge overseeing the 9/11 cases against Khalid Sheikh Mohammed and others will examine if it was legal for Lloyd Austin to rescind their plea agreements.
summary: A judge overseeing the 9/11 cases against Khalid Sheikh Mohammed and others will examine if it was legal for Lloyd Austin to rescind their plea agreements.

title: Ukraine says captured Russian soldiers could be part of prisoner exchange
content: President Volodymyr Zelensky and his top military commander claimed more gains in advance in Kursk.
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky and his top military commander claimed more gains in advance in Kursk.

title: Disease was spreading in Gaza. Now there’s polio in the sewage.
content: Israel’s war in Gaza has destroyed its water and sanitation infrastructure, leaving sewage in the streets as a breeding ground for infectious diseases.
summary: Israel’s war in Gaza has destroyed its water and sanitation infrastructure, leaving sewage in the streets as a breeding ground for infectious diseases.
